thread.title: Kendrick Lamar Recruits SZA For Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show [Watch]
thread.title_full: Kendrick Lamar Recruits SZA For Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show [Watch]

author: Andrew O'Brien
title: Kendrick Lamar Recruits SZA For Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show [Watch]
text:
[Update 1/23/25]: Kendrick Lamar will be joined by frequent collaborator SZA when he headlines the Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show at New Orleans, LAâ€™s Caesars Superdome on February 9th, 2025. In a promo clip shared on Tuesday, SZA announces her appearance by running up behind Kendrick on a football field set and dousing him with a celebratory cooler full of lemonade as his 2024 track â€œhey nowâ€ plays in the background.
Plenty has happened for both Kendrick Lamar and SZA since the rapperâ€™s Super Bowl headlining gig was announced in October 2024. Following the initial announcement, New Orleans-native rapper Lil Wayne was vocal about his disappointment that he was not offered the halftime show in his home city. â€œThat hurt, it hurt a lot,â€ he said in a statement posted on Instagram. â€œIt broke me, but Iâ€™m just trying to put myself back together.â€
Lamar went on to release his sixth studio album, GNX, on November 22nd. The feeling of immediacy that pervades the LP is perhaps most apparent in a line from opening track â€œwacced out muralsâ€ that directly references Wayneâ€™s comments a month prior: â€œUsed to bump Tha Carter III, I held my Rollie chain proud / Irony, I think my hard work let Lil Wayne down.â€
GNX also featured two separate collaborations with SZA, â€œlutherâ€ and â€œgloriaâ€. The prolific pair added to their joint resume yet again when SZAâ€™s new SOS Deluxe: LANA, released on December 20th, featured a third new Kendrick collab, â€œ30 For 30â€.
Kendrick Lamar and SZA also announced an extensive co-headlining stadium tour dubbed the Grand National Tour. Due to run from mid-April through mid-June, the 21-date trekâ€™s billing is a nod to GNX, which takes its name from the limited-run 1987 Buick â€œGrand National Experimentâ€ coup, a model known by many as one of the last great American muscle cars. Find a full list of dates here. Tickets are on sale now via Ticketmaster. You can also see whatâ€™s available on the secondary market here.
Watch the announcement video for SZAâ€™s appearance at the Kendrick Lamar-led Super Bowl Halftime Show in New Orleans below. Scroll down for more background on Lamarâ€™s Super Bowl appearance.

[January 23, 2025]
[9/9/24]: Kendrick Lamar, the Compton-native rapper who scored one of the summerâ€™s biggest hits with â€œNot Like Usâ€ thanks to a highly publicized series of blow-for-blow dis tracks levied between him and rival MC Drake earlier this year, has announced that he will headline the Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show at New Orleans, LAâ€™s Caesars Superdome on February 9th, 2025.
In a Dave Free-directed clip announcing hisâ€™s appearance at the Apple Music-sponsored Super Bowl Halftime Show in 2025, the rapper appears on a football field in front of a massive American flag backdrop. While he uses a passing machine to fire off practice throws to an off-camera receiver, Lamar deadpans, â€œWhat the deal, everybody? My name Kendrick Lamar and Iâ€™ll be performing at Super Bowl LIX [59]. Will you be pullinâ€™ up? I hope so.â€
â€œBoom!â€ he adds as one of his passes seems to hit its receiver in the numbers. â€œI wouldnâ€™t want you to miss it. Meet me in New Orleans. February 9th, 2025. Wear your best dress, too, even if youâ€™re watching from home.â€
While the Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show will mark Lamarâ€™s first time leading the annual spectacle, he notably appeared during the Super Bowl LVI Halftime Show in Inglewood, CA alongside fellow hip-hop luminaries like Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Mary J. Blige, Eminem, 50 Cent, and Anderson .Paak in early 2022. That edition marked the first time a rapper had headlined the Halftime Show. Read our full rundown of that performance and its significance here.
Related: Dr. Dre & His ProtÃ©gÃ©s: Hip-Hop Royalty Finally Captures The Super Bowl Halftime Show Stage
Lamar also seemingly throws another jab at Drake in the announcement video. Earlier this year, after the two rappers traded dis tracks for weeks this past spring, Lamarâ€™s scathing â€œNot Like Usâ€ helped him pull away as the war of wordsâ€™ consensus winner. He only added to that perception on Juneteenth when he hosted a one-off show at L.A.â€™s Kia Forum billed as The Pop Out during which he welcomed out a crew of notable guests including Mustard, Ty Dolla Sign, Dom Kennedy, Steve Lacy, Tyler, the Creator, Roddy Ricch, YG, Schoolboy Q, Jay Rock, Ab-Soul, and Dr. Dre. and performed four of his five Drake-aimed diss tracksâ€”â€Like Thatâ€, â€œEuphoriaâ€, â€œ6:16 in LAâ€, and â€œNot Like Usâ€â€”for the first time during his headlining set. Seemingly adding insult to injury, Lamar performed â€œNot Like Usâ€, the de facto â€œnail in the coffinâ€ for the Kendrick/Drake beef, five separate times at the show.
Note: There are plenty of explanations and [breakdowns of the Kendrick Lamar/Drake feud out there online, but we think this explanation Chet Hanks gave his dad, Tom Hanks, is as good as any.]
[Screengrabs via Chet Hanks Instagram â€“ Chet Hanks explains Kendrick/Drake beef to Tom Hanks, May 2024]
While things seemed to simmer down after that, Drake has since begun dumping large caches of music, demos, video clips, and other content in 100gb chunks. At the time of his first â€œ100 Gigsâ€ drop, Drake posted an Instagram story on his @plottttwistttttt Instagram account featuring a photo of former professional basketball player Rasheed Wallace and accompanying text quoting a famous 2004 interview by the Detroit Piston during the NBA Finals: â€œWe will win Game 2.â€ Many fans took the eventually deleted post as both an admission of his defeat in the rap beef du jour and a forecast of his intentions to come at Kendrick once again in the future.
[Related: Kendrick Lamar Brings â€˜The Big Steppers Tourâ€™ To New Orleans [Review]](https://liveforlivemusic.com/features/reviews/kendrick-lamar-mr-morale-the-big-steppers-tour-2022-new-orleans/)
In the video announcing Lamarâ€™s Super Bowl performance, as the American flag towers behind him, Kendrick throws a bit more â€œsweet chin musicâ€ at Drake, his Canadian rival. â€œYou know thereâ€™s only one opportunity to win a championship. No â€™round twos.â€™ Letâ€™s get it!â€
